events.name: Pre-Hackathon Info Session
events.description:
National Supercomputing Centre (NSCC) Singapore invites you to join us at the NSCC Pre-Hackathon Workshop where participants can learn how to develop innovative ideas that can be accelerated and scaled using a supercomputer. 
Why should you join? 
Come and meet like-minded innovators to share ideas, hear from leading experts in supercomputing, and form teams ahead of the Hackathon. 
Agenda:  
4:00pm – 4:25pm: Value Proposition: The Key to Successful Innovation 
Speaker: Douglas Abrams, Founder and CEO of Expara Ventures 
Douglas Abrams is the founder of Expara, SEA’s leading early-stage VC. He has launched two seed-stage and two early-stage venture funds in Singapore since 2007. Prior to moving here in 2000, Mr. Abrams managed IT at JPMorgan for 14 years. He is also an Adjunct Associate Professor at the NUS Business School and a Visiting Professor for Sasin at Chulalongkorn University Bangkok. He has a BA in Communications from the University of Pennsylvania and an MBA from The Wharton School. 
4:25pm – 4:50pm: What is a supercomputer and what can I do with it for this hackathon? 
Speaker: Ong Guan Sin, Principal Research Engineer, National Supercomputing Centre 
Guan Sin is currently the principal research engineer of National Supercomupting Centre (NSCC) Singapore. He has more than two decades of experience in IT industry in systems engineering, security, application development, IT management, innovation and business development. He has worked in universities and start ups, as well as in systems integration and the financial sector. In his spare time, he is an avid marathoner having completed an ultra-marathon in 2010. 
4:50pm – 5:15pm: GPU Accelerates Innovation & Business 
Speaker: Ettikan Karuppiah, Developers Ecosystem Director, NVIDIA, APAC South 
Ettikan Kandasamy Karuppiah (Ph.D) serves as Director, Developers Ecosystem at NVIDIA APAC South assisting innovators and techno-entrepreneurs to accelerate GPU adaptation for their solutioning needs. He has direct R&D experience in HPC space as a R&D engineer with numerous publication and patents from his past work. He also led research teams and technology commercialization effort during this period. 
5:15pm – 5:30pm: Q&A 
5:30pm – 6:00pm: Networking and Closing 
Note: By registering for the Pre-hackathon Info Session, you consent to receive electronically all marketing and promotional materials from NSCC.
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02 - 01, Singapore 139951 null

events.name: PyLadies June Meetup
events.description:
We haven't had a meetup in quite a while, so why don't we gather at Carousell's beautiful cosy office and have some pizza :)

Grace Tang will give us a sneek preview of her PyCon talk "Creating map visualizations with open data and Folium". If you have no idea what this is about, don't worry, I don't know as well - but that's why I can't wait to come and see her talk ;)

You can find out more about her talk here: https://pycon.sg/schedule/presentation/100/

And do check out all the other PyCon talks here: https://pycon.sg/schedule/list/ - it is not too late to get your PyCon ticket ;)

events.name: Lets talk about Project Management!
events.description: Lets get together over a drink and share some tips and experience in dealing with challenging projects. This meet up will be conducted in a relaxed atmosphere so chillax! Free snacks will be provided. Bumped into troubles in your projects? Feel free to toss in questions and let the group give some feedback to you. If you have one topic or two that you would like to talk about, dont hesitate to bring them up as well. The meet up will follow the lean coffee structure. Everybody can suggest a topic or two, and then vote on the topic that interest them. One person can vote twice and may use all their votes on one topic. Topics get the most votes will get the spot light and will be selected for the night. Limited seats only 20 available.
events.location: Kazbar , 25 Church Street #01-03 Capital Square 3 Singapore 049482

events.name: Functional Programming in Scala Coursera Study Group
events.location: Lowercase, 1 McNally St, Blk D #01-01, Singapore

events.name: Design Innovation Dialogue - Failing your way to Success
events.description: John Lambie contacted me and offered to run at the Hub a Design Thinking session.Join him at the Hub this Thursday at 7 pm. Design Session: Failing your way to Success What's the surest way to succeed in business? By planning to fail - to fail early, to fail readily and to fail often.Join this fun, fast and furious interactive workshop and master some simple but powerful design thinking tools. Tools to help you smash through the success barrier by reimaging the way you: - frame your business- define your goals- generate awesome ideas- create winning products and services- grow your revenue Join designer, inventor and founder John Lambie as he takes you through the the fastest, simplest and smartest path to success - by embracing failure. He'll also share his international journey in creating Dextr - a preposterously simple design idea that is speeding the adaption to technology in some of the poorest but most populous countries in the world. See you from 7 pm at The Hub.

events.name: Big Data, Small Machine (June hardcore bonus meetup)
events.description: Hi all,  NOTE: Please refer to the new attendance policy before RSVP to this meetup. RSVP will only open on 5th June, Sunday (12pm) and closes on 16th June (12am).  For our June bonus meetup, we're excited to have Adam Drake, CEO / Chief Data Officer of Atazzo. [Warning: This is going to be a hardcore meetup. We will be doing code demos, and talking about generators, iterative methods for learning on large data sets and doing operations on in-memory data structure without locking]. 6.45pm-7pm: Networking session [casual; small talk]  7pm-7.45pm: Big Data, Small Machine by Adam Drake. Sypnosis: Datasets too large to fit into RAM are increasingly common, even in simple environments like Kaggle competitions. Adam will introduce some ways of dealing with this issue in addition to demonstrating some scalable machine learning techniques which are production ready and capable of processing over 10s of thousands of events per second on an old laptop. [hardcore]. 7.45pm-8.30pm: Networking session [casual; small talk]  [] : Suggested rating and topic; ranges from: newbie - casual - core - hardcore. Speaker Bio:   I have been in technology roles in a variety of industries, including online marketing, financial services, healthcare, and oil and gas. My background is in Applied Mathematics, I help companies change and use data more effectively, and my technical interests include online learning systems, high-frequency/low-latency data processing systems, recommender systems, distributed systems, and functional programming. https://www.linkedin.com/in/aadrake RSVP will only open on 5th June, Sunday (12pm) and closes on 16th June (12am).
events.location: Singapore Management University School of Information Systems Seminar Room 2-4, 80 Stamford Road, 178902, Level 2
